alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 18 at 7:37PM EST until November 18 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN CARBON AND MONROE COUNTIES... At 737 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Blooming Grove to near Palmerton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 72 and 88. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 291 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 6. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Palmerton, Jim Thorpe, Wind Gap, Stormville, Werry Lake, Skytop, Tannersville, Long Pond, Kresgeville, Sun Valley, Reeders, Beltzville State Park, Saylorsburg, McMichael, Canadensis, Penn Forest Reservoir and Christmans. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
